text.jpText:
『こんなところで読書……？』
そんな顔だな、トレーナー君。
text.enText:
Wondering why I'm reading in a place<n>like this?
Your face betrays you, Trainer.

text.jpText:
『人を見て法を説く』という
言葉があるだろう？
text.enText:
Have you ever heard that the law should<n>serve
the people, as opposed to the<n>other way around?

text.jpText: 人を知らずに教えは説けず、逆もまた然り。
text.enText:
It's a reminder that knowing your<n>constituents is
vital to governing, but<n>one must also know the
law to teach it.

text.jpText:
故に、私は法を学びつつ、人を見る。
一挙両得という訳だ。君も試してみるといい。
text.enText:
Therefore, I am studying the law while<n>also
observing the people. Killing two<n>birds with one
stone, if you will. You<n>should try it sometime.
